title: Revert operation in java editor is slower than close and reopen
description: When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor after answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original. However, if I repeat steps 1 and 2, and then double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the file is reopened almost instantly. This behavior seems odd because reverting the file contents should not take more time than simply closing and reopening the file.
OB: After answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The 'Revert' operation should be as fast as or faster than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the java editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
4. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
5. Observe the time it takes to replace the contents of the window with the original.
6. Repeat steps 1 and 2.
7. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
8. Observe the time it takes to reopen the file.
